snippet: A slowdown linked to a weak economy and structural changes could help alleviate the country’s fiscal troubles.
abstract: Sharp and surprisingly persistent slowdown in the growth of health care costs is helping to narrow the federal deficit; budget experts are trying to figure out whether the trend will last and how much the slower growth could help alleviate the country’s long-term fiscal problems; Congressional Budget Office has erased hundreds of billions of dollars in projected spending on Medicare and Medicaid; new data also show overall health care spending growth continuing at the lowest rate in decades for a fourth consecutive year.
lead_paragraph: A slowdown linked to a weak economy and structural changes could help alleviate the country’s fiscal troubles.

headline.seo: Sharp Slowdown in U.S. Health Care Costs Eases Deficit
headline.main: Slower Growth of Health Costs Eases Budget Deficit
headline.print_headline: Slower Growth Of Health Costs Narrows Deficit
